intro: Baeobotrys glabra, commonly known as the smooth baeobotry, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature, contributing to its dispersal in the wild.
